questions.question: So the question is, what happened between 300,000 and 400,000 years ago to produce Homo sapiens?
And the other kind of value is things that are good for the males, such as, hey, guess what?
What kind of experiment would we need to discover whether or not anybody could fall into this position?
Don't you think there's some value to conflict for the improvement of society, for progress?
How big of an invention from an engineering perspective do you think is the discovery of fire?
Do you think for the homo erectus, homo sapiens, do you think it's the greatest invention ever?
What did males and females do with the time they were saving from not having to chew their food?
Why is all of us as individuals terrified when you know there's millions of us?
Can you maybe comment on the full complexity and richness of the human mind through this process?
Or is it as simple as this language emerging from taking over the alpha male and the cooperation?
Now that we know how many planets have the right sort of conditions, which is what?
